transportAdvice: Tricycles (motorized three-wheelers) are the main form of local transport and cover most tourist areas, while jeepneys serve longer routes within the city. Taxis are available but less common than tricycles; many attractions outside the city require organized tours or hired vehicles as walking between sites is generally not practical.

weather.description: Dry and sunny with comfortable temperatures, making it one of the best months to visit.
Continued dry conditions with clear skies and pleasant breezes, ideal for island hopping and outdoor activities.
Temperatures begin to rise with very little rainfall, excellent for beach and nature excursions.
Hot and dry with strong sunshine; one of the warmest months but still good for travel.
The transition into the wet season begins, with occasional afternoon showers becoming more frequent.
Rainy season is underway with regular heavy downpours, and some tours may be disrupted by weather.
One of the wettest months, with persistent rain and rough seas that can limit boat-based activities.
Heavy rainfall continues and typhoon risk is elevated, making travel planning less predictable.
Still firmly in the wet season with frequent storms; outdoor and coastal activities are often restricted.
Rainfall begins to ease toward the end of the month as the dry season approaches, but showers remain common.
Conditions improve noticeably with fewer rainy days and more sunshine returning to the region.
The dry season is re-established, bringing cooler evenings and clear days that are great for sightseeing.
